result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard George Green

defendant.name: Green, Richard George
defendant.address: 1220 S. 1st Street, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821

records.addlTxt:
11:25 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Richard George Green appeared by video.  Attorney Daniel M Key appeared by video for Richard George Green.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Key is heard.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney

2:01 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Richard George Green appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant requests that the county appoint an attorney. 

Court finds the defendant is partially indigent and will have the court appoint an attorney. Court approves an order for income withholding to send to employer - Huckleberry's  
$25.00 per paycheck.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 31, 2022 at 11:15 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
1:59 PM Defendant Richard George Green appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is heard on retaining an attorney, defendant contacted the Public Defenders office.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
SPD Office indicates that Mr. Green called their office and he is not eligible for a public defender at this time.

1:30 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Richard George Green in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

3:17 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Richard George Green II appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause - will address bond

Atty. Steiner is heard on issue of bond - requests $250.00 cash with conditions no contact with L.L., Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.  Def not to enter any taverns.
Def. is heard on bond-  

Court orders $250.00 cash bond, with conditions
Defendant shall have no contact with L.L.
Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. 
Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 
Def not to enter any taverns. 

Right to counsel explained to defendant
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant shall have no contact with L.L. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Def not to enter any taverns.
